text: Bottle @ fonefan tasting. Nice creamy head with good duration. Color is black. Aroma and taste are nice cinnamon, chocolate, coffee, caramel, hops and has a nice balanced spicy finish.Earlier Rating: 3/2/2012 Total Score: 4.4Bottle from Ølkonsortiet. Huge brown head with awesome duration. Color is black. Watching this beer in a glass is pure art! Aroma and taste are rich licorice, roast malt, bitter chocolate, coffee and hops. Full bodied and soft carbonated. Excellent beer!

UPDATED: MAR 13, 2017 Bottle, 10%. Black with medium brown head. Aroma is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, spices and cinnamon. Flavour is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, spices, cinnamon, sweet, caramel, hop and medium bitter.Earlier Rating: 11/4/2011 Total Score: 4.4

Tap @ FairBar. Black with big brown head. Aroma is roasted malts, chocolate and liquorice. Flavour is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, liquorice, dark fruits, hops and medium bitter.
@Ulfborg Scooper. Black with thick tan head. Roasted aroma, licorice and cinnamon. Flavour has licorice, cinnamon and coffee. Has a little alc bite in the finish.

Bottle @ fonefan tasting. Black with a small brown head. Aroma is sweet, roasted malt, chocolate, coffee and cinnamon. Flavor is very sweet and rather bitter. Dry and rather bitter finish with warming alcohol. Oily. 040317Earlier Rating: 11/4/2011 Total Score: 4.4Black with a lasting dark brown head. Aroma is sweet, roasted malt, dark chocolate and a little coffee. Flavor is quite sweet and rather bitter. Dry and rather bitter finish with warming alcohol. Smooth and oily. 031111
Bottle, batch 300. Pours black with small beige head. Aroma of coffee, vanilla, dark chocolate, (plums). Taste of vanilla, cocoa, raisins, apricot perhaps. Full body, oily texture, soft carbonation.

Bottle courtesy of Christian. Pours deep black with a brown head. Aroma of choco, sweet malts, vanilla, light roast, wood, berries. Taste is sweet, vinous, coffee, light spice, light cellar. Dry wood finish. Nice.

From bottle, 2011 - thanks a lot Scheffel! Pours pitch black with a brown head. Aroma of dark chocolate, vanilla, roasted malts, light sweet liqourice. Taste is heavy coffee, light liqourice, vanilla, melasses, body is a bit thinner than expected. Way better than expected, this is really good!

december 12, 2015. Bottle at home, received in a trade with Dedollewaitor, thanks! 
Black with a large brown head. Aroma is dark chocolate, plum, licorice, leather, coffee, hints of tobacco, wood, dark berries. Taste is light sweet, roasted and a bit sour. Finish is slight salty, light sweet with plum and licorice, bitter chocolate, earthy and woody notes, some tobacco and a sourish finish. Medium bodied, quite creamy texture with a dry finish, soft carbonation. 
There is a good beer behind the sour notes, unfortunately the sourness is too prominent and takes over too much in the end.

Fantastique.superbe mousse qui donne envie de sy plonger.. au nez, on est sur du chocolat au lait,café, caramel,vanille.on sent que ca va etre épais!!!!
En bouche, ben, cest bien ça, épais,chocolat, épicé, café sur la fin, merveille de suce et damertume, définitivement une excellente bière de Noel, meme en plein mois de Juillet...

Sweetish malty beginning. Lots of sugary sweetness, sticky, hints of roast, lots of malty sweetness with caramelly-roasted parts. Not too bitter in the aftertaste, lots of sweetness, candy sugar, malt.

Bottle from Plovmand, thanks! Lots of licorice in this one, as well as vinous woody notes. Strong pumpernikel aromas, some coffee. Full bodied, only light sweet, light salty as well which is really nice (licorice!). Moccha-like finish, light bitter, lots of black olives as well. Nicely hidden alcohol. I loved the flavour depth. Excellent.

(Bottle 0.33, few months after best before) Black untransparent colour. Brown, thick, medium sized, slowly falling head. Nice lacing. Full body, oily to syrupy texture, low carbonation, very smooth mouthfeel. Aroma: Very rich, medium to strong burned, light wood, sherry, licorice, dark chocolate. taste: medium sweet, light to moderate burned bitterness, licorice dark chocolate, coffee, very good hidden alcohol. Great balanced, realy tasty, rich in taste and aroma beer. Very strong but still easy to drink.
Bottle at Craigs. Pours black, nose is meaty. ginger, nutmeg, chocolate, taste is similar, fruity.

(Bottle) Pitch black colour with lasting, creamy brown head. Malty, roasted, slightly vinous nose with notes of strong black coffee, liquorice, dark chocolate, blueberries and a touch of tar. Malty, roasted taste with dark chocolate, coffee, liquorice, blueberries, hints of tobacco and tar and a generous cocoa bitterness in the finish. Full body, quite smooth and mellow mouthfeel. Just a touch of sweetness, but mainly dry. Exceptionally well balanced, with alcohol well hidden. Lovely beer!

Thanks to hallinghansen for the bottle
330 ML bottle


Black pour with touches of ruby. Dark leather head. Lots of residual oil afterwards. Menacing beer in a good way.
Nose is treacle, Vegemite, roasted malts, and dry dark chocolate. Excellent nose. 
Taste is similar to nose. A bit of dry burnt rubber but very smooth. Thick, rich and bone dry. Well hidden ABV and similar to midnight sun stouts in viscosity and dryness. Excellent beer.

Shared bottle at the Midlands Meet on 24th Aug 2014. Needed a bigger bottle (or less of us), because a 6th share was not enough for me. It poured dark brown with thin off-white head. Aroma of vanilla, chocolate, malty molasses, coffee and liquorice. The taste follows along with hints of dark fruitiness. Good brew that hid the alcohol nicely within its flavours and body depth.

Black beer with small head. Aroma of licorice and coffee. Taste is treacle, licorice, chocolate and roasted malts. Sticky palate. Very good.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text: Bottle midland tasting group. Black tan head. Choc fruity aroma taste is same nice malts lots of vanilla blackcurrant good bitterness. V good this.

Bottle @ the inaugural Midlands Bottle Share at Richies Hop Palace. Thanks to Tommann. Pours very dark brown with thin beige head. Aroma of chocolate, dark malts and faint coffee. Taste follows with some additional plump fruitiness coming through. Another great strong beer to end the night with.
Bottle at Midlands Tasting Group; dark brown pour with a thin dark tan head, chocolate and spice aroma, taste has dark chocolate, spice, dark fruit.

Winter porter with thick, light beige, quickly thinning head and near black colour. Woody and chocolatey aroma, ashes, soy sauce, brown sugar; candied fruits, deep maltiness, full mouthfeel, roasted bitterness and quite some hop bitterness in the finish.

Bottle at Cafe Local.
APPEARANCE: pitch black beer, nice stable beige head.
NOSE: bourbon? Mocha, vanilla, alcohol, some herbs.
TASTE: rather sweet, alcohol, mocha, vanilla.

[Thanks to Plovmand]. Blak colour with a tan head with good duration and medium lacing. Aroma has notes of coffee beans, licorice, chocolate and roasted malts. Flavor s quiete similar as aroma with a medium bitterness, soma ashes as well. The final is mild bittery with coffee and licorice notes and dry mouthfeel. Dense and smooth on palate.

Bottle. Deep dark/blackish with huge brown head. Aroma of roasted malts, notes of coffee, chocolate and prunes. Cocoa sweetness is replaced by a heavy dose of long lasting, dark, malty bitterness. Very nice and straight forward beer

330mL shared with GT2 for my birthday. Black pour with smaller head. Nose of creme fraiche, bitter dark chocolate, spicy chili pepper, peppercorn, Taste is melted Mexican dark chocolate. Great balance of bitter and sweet. Downed this puppy fast. So well integrated, easy to enjoy. Loved it.

> The superlative imperial porter
[ Bottle ][ blomster ][ 33cl ][ Pizza Poy Snifter ][ Trade ][ 2/24/14 ]
>> Thank you Christer for this rarity. Was expecting this one to be good- it was beyond excellent. Soft carbonation generates a low, but tight reddish mocha head on inkier black ruby to ink. Nose generates the best aged Bells Expedition with cinnamon graham cracker, light vanilla, thicker Mexican chocolate disc, black cherry pie. Taste is dark chocolate with black cherry flambee, cinnamon graham cracker, 70% cacao Mexican chocolate disc, mild pepper spice. Palate is similar to drinking chocolate with crunchy cocoa nibs. Decadent but not sweet at all, rather perfectly balanced and has a transcendental quality that makes me not treat this like an Imperial Stout as hops and roast as not crucial elements here. Body isnt too heavy either. For any im-porter lover out there, this is a rarity worth seeking out. 

<!> too good to only have once

Bottle @ Christmas at Erik og Betinna. Pitch black, small tan head, good lacing and coating. Aroma, roasted malts, chocolate, dark fruits, alcohol, caramel, spices (nutmeg), honey, . Taste, roasted malts, sweet chocolate, coffee, dry licorice, spices, honey, . Oily, slightly dry, mouth feel. Soft carbonation. Roasted sweet spicy aftertaste.

Pours dark with low brown head
Aromas of muscavado, dark malts, figs, dades, 
Lovely taste of tar, chocolate, coffee, figs, muscavado sugar
Very nice creamy palate with long bitter finish

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Black pour with a tan head. The aroma is full of chocolate, red wine and oak. The flavor is a mix of ash, chocolate and roasted malt. Thick mouthfeel and medium carbonation.

Bottle. 10.0%. Best before 2015. Pours pitch black with a dark tan head. Good lacing. Roasted aroma, slightly fruity fruity at first, with a bread note. As it warms, the fruity note becomes more outspoken and a barbecue note appears. Flavour is sweet and a bit tart; berry-like, with roasted and sweet liquorice notes. Clove-like note and a faint honey note as it warms. A bit cloying. Sweetish, roasted finish, sweet liquorice as it warms. Lingering sweet, tart and roasted note. Overall good, but a bit cloying. 17.10.13.

This thing pours like motor oil topped by a huge head of melted mocha ice cream. Seriously, the head look like you could eat it with a spoon. Aroma strong and spicy, a good deal of roast, huge chocolate, coffee, cherry, vanilla... After smelling this beer I actually got up and went looking for a piece of bread to cleanse my palate. Taste is very roasty and full, chocolate, coffee, ash, caramel, toffee, vanilla. Palate roasty and rich. Fantastic beer
(330ml bottle) Pours an opaque black body with a small brown head. Aroma of roasted malt, chocolate, toffee, and caramel. Flavor of roasted malt, ash, smoke, anise, caramel, raisins, and chocolate.

(330ml bottle thanks to bu11zeye) deep black, dark fine tan bubble. Nose of ash, rich chocolate, dark cocoa, vanilla, oats, rich and decadent. Taste of dark chocolate, cocoa, vanilla, very chocolaty, chocolate wafers, an awesome beer.

Bottle (33cl). Pitch black colour. Half-inch dark beige head (with a gradient towards brown), fairly good retention, settles as a thin ring. Leaves a viscous film on the glass when swirled. Sweet roasted malt aroma with chocolate, coffee, wood, hint of menthol. Full body, soft carbonation, somewhat oily mouthfeel, but does not feel very heavy. Taste is sweet, nicely balanced by a woody bitterness, and a certain acidity in the finish.

Solid black with a decent chocolate head that leaves some nice lacing. Aroma is chocolate, charred oak, vanilla, hazelnut, coffee and a hint of booze. Velvety mouthfeel, good balance of sweet and roasty on the palate, long roasty sweet finish. Taste is chocolate, coffee cake, vanilla, fig, oak, liquorice, hint of dark soy. Delicious.

Pours a dark brown with a lite brown head. The nose is spiced fruit cake, coffee, and cocoa nibs. That pallet is really nice. It starts out with chocolate cake and dates, followed by cocoa nibs, a subtle oak and dulce de leche. It finishes with a lingering bitter sweet chocolate. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

33cl bottle thanks to Papsoe. Dark color with thin brown head. Body is oily and carbonation is low. Bitterness is high, sweetness is low, and theres also some sourness over here. Aroma is high coffee, hop, resin and alcohol.

33 cl bottle shared by Adam Jackson last night. Aroma of malt, burnt grain, charred malt and licorice. Strong roasted notes. Poured pitch black in color with a tiny dense, brown head that died quickly. Carbonation is low. Tastes just like it smells. Flavor overall is pretty sweet. Texture of this porter is on the oily side. Leaves a oily film on the tongue.
12oz shared with a friend. chalky taste, chocolate and licorice finish. nose is bakers chocolate and some brown sugar. finishes pretty nice. ABV and mouthfeel are in line.

# 3218
ersma: batch 300. eine reihe von bieren wird mit etiketten versehen, die künstler entworfen haben.
tiefschwarz und ölig im glas, viel dunkelbrauner schaum.
der geruch ist süßlich, spritig mit röstmalz, lakritz und kaffee.
der antrunk ist überraschend herb, dazu röstig, auch hier lakritz und kaffee, zudem toffee und pflaume. die mittebleibt herb, mehr pflaume und dazu schoko. der abgang ist hopfenbetont mit lakritz, pflaume und schoko sowie vielen röstmalzigen aromen.
die flasche zeigt dein bild des künstlers johnny madsen
fazit: sehr aromatisch, probierenswert. wird aber leider nicht mehr hergestellt.
13,11,11,11,11,11		-	11,20		-	23/2/1

12/II/13 - 33cl bottle from Alvinne shop (Moen) @ home - BBE: 2015 (2013-162) 
Clear dark purple to black beer, big solid creamy brown head, unstable, bit adhesive. Aroma: sugary, overripe banana, caramel, mocha, juniper berries, very spicy, dry, peppery, dusty. MF: lots of carbon, medium to full body, creamy to oily texture. Taste: sour start, mocha and coffee, caramel, syrupy, berries, dried fruits, raisins, dark chocolate. Aftertaste: overripe fruits, berries, spices, cinnamon, liquorish, dark caramel, cocoa powder, coffee, little sweet.

Bottle acquired via awesome trade with KingCecil!  Squid ink pour with a beautiful latte head that left lacing inside the goblet.  Fragrant mocha, brownie batter, and fudge-filled nose with some light coffee and vanilla.  Godiva, Hersheys and Starbucks in flavor...rich and decadent.  Creamy mouthfeel.  A delicious surprise!  Smart of the locals to keep this a secret so they have more for themselves!

33cl bottle shared by my friend Chris, who kindly brought it back from Denmark.  Medium brown head atop motor-oily black body.  Aroma is moderately sweet, bittersweet chocolate/cocoa, roast, coffee, some raisin, vanilla, nut.  Taste is moderately sweet, milk chocolate/cocoa, roast, some coffee, light vanilla.  Sticky full body, alcohol present but not overpowering.

12 oz. bottle from Papsoe. It pours very thick and dark dark brown with a huge, fluffy dark brown head. The aroma good god yall rich and decadent doesnt begin to describe. Big time dark fruitiness with fig newton, dark chocolate, brown sugar, treacle, hints of cafe mocha. Very sweet and rich on the nose. The flavor is the same. Incredibly thick body, one of the thickest beers I can remember with notes of black cherry, wood, tobacco, molasses, fig, char, roast, etc. More roasted than the aroma suggested. Very sweet, but the intense roast balances it out just a tad. Wow. What a special brew. Not for the faint of heart.

330ml bottle ,batch 300, bought at Ølbutikken in Copenhagen in May this year. Oily pour revealing a huge, bubbly brownish head with good retention and fine lacework to the glass. Jet black body. Aroma of chocolate and cocoa. Gentle confectionery chocolate to the taste buds. The sweetness is downplayed by dark fruits and a vibe of roasted bitterness. Very smooth in the mouth. Excellent Yuletide sipper (Tromsø, 26.12.2012).

0,33 l bottle at Timo As. Black color.  Sweet aroma of salty licorice, dark fruits. Firm roasty flavor with coffee, rum, warming alcohol. Woody spices (clove, smoke) in finish. Full body. Not so drinkable but still a nice sipper.

330 ml bottle courtesy of Enjoyit. Pours pitch black with a small creamy mocha head that leaves a small trace on the glass while dissipating. Smell is sweet and slightly fruity with roasted malts, raisins, alcohol, cherries in brandy, pumpernickel bread, salty liquorice candy, charred wood, prunes and hints of grass. Taste is sweet and bitter with roasted malts, peppery raw vegetables, resinous wood, dark roast coffee, prunes, raisins, alcohol, figs, rubber, Christmas fruitcake, bitter chocolate, salty liquorice and pine. Mouthfeel is round, creamy, slightly boozy, tiny astringent and medium to full bodied. Finish is slightly sweet, bitter and fruity with roasted malts, salty liquorice, prunes, raisins, resinous wood, black tea, dark roast coffee, moist soil and orange peal.

Bottle 33 cl @ DTTEOD. Pours pitch black with a small tanned head. Aroma is sweet raisins figs malty fruity. Flavor is sweet roasted sourish a bit thin body bitter, characterless Im afraid. Finishes bitter roasted.

Bottled at DTTEOD
Pitch black with a beige head. 
Sweet and vinous aroma; loads of sweet fruits figs and raisin. 
Chocolaty flavour and slightly sourish. Rather thin body. Vinous.

Bottle with many thanks to Ramy. Pours black with brown head. Nose is fantastic - lots of fudge brownie, smoked chocolate malt, smoked licorice, vanilla, cinnamon, gingerbread christmas cookie and mild spice. Taste follows suit albeit slightly less pronounced. Medium body. Well balanced.

Pitch black with a massive reddish brown head that lasts.

Aroma of dark fruit with alcohol and malty notes. Taste is malty, roasty, complex with light acidity from cherries. The taste lingers in the mouth a while leaving rich fruity notes and a hint of bitterness.

Nice beer.

Bottle.
Pours black with a big brown head.
Nice warming chcolate and spicy aroma.
A big brew with a round mouthfeel, sweet (dark fruits and chcolate) and salty (soy sauce)

Bottle. Looks very good! Black with a big brown head. Heavy roasty notes in aroma, and also small notes of licorice, red wine and milk chocolate. Taste is dark and roasted at first. Very chocolaty with some vinousity  and a touch of hops in the finish. And coffee!

Serving: 330 ml. bottle via Papsoe.  Thanks Henrik!  It pours almost pitch black with a  monsterous brown head.  The nose is lighter than I was expecting given the looks of this brew.  Light roasted malt, cocoa, and light dried fruit notes.  The flavor brings a big blast of roasted bitterness.  There is light smoke, burnt notes, earth, a slight metallic twinge, and a little boozy fruitiness.  Lots going on in this one.  Definitely full bodied with lots of smooth carbonation.  Very nice indeed.

Pours a pitch black beer with a chocolate head. The aroma is malt, rye bread and spices. The flavor follows the nose with additional alcohol. The palate is sweetness with alcoholwarmth. Overall a good beer.

UPDATED: SEP 14, 2013 Bottle. Black thick, thick bubbly, creamy dark beige long lasting foam.
Vanilla, alcohol, fudge, toffee, light sweet tropical fruit notes. Sweet chocolate. Little bitterness, soft on the palate and doesnt really feel all that heavy despite the style and abv. Smooth and very pleasant.
Bottled 50cl. Courtesy of jaghana. Smooth, low carbonation. Tar and coffeee throughout. Very good. Thanks a lot jaghana!

Bottle, enjoyed september 15th 2012. Full black body, large thick brown head. Strong roasty aroma with licorice, caramel and orange. Taste of wood, coffee, ash, chocolate. Creamy thick body, fruity and malty. Good dry bitterness with lots of roast and licorice in aftertaste. A fantastic beer.

Bottle @ home. Black pour, creamy tan head. Aroma is spicy, some anise, licorice, coffee, chocolate and creamy roasted malts. Flavor is bitter spicy roasted, some herbs and quite thick bodied and well balanced. A bit strange but rather nice.
Bottle @ home. Aroma is chocolate, liquorice, molasses, some spicy notes and some coffee. Flavour is deep roast, big big coffee, some liquorice, mocca, caramel and more. Hefty and awesome.
Bottle at home ... Deep black ... big bubbly tan head ... rich meaty malt ... ginger and nutmeg spice  nose... deep roast ... dark fruits ... plums ... treacle ... spice .. big big meaty chocolate

In bottle at Craigs. Pours a black colour with a decent tan head. Aroma of ginger, nutmeg, dark chocolate, caramel and alcohol. Similar flavours with moderate carbonation and a chewy mouth-feel. Nicely bitter with lingering ginger, nutmeg and chocolate again. Alcohol is very well balanced. Superb!
From a bottle shared on the train returning from the  Borefts beer festival, de Molen, day two.  Pous black with a tan head.  Prunes, raisins, vanilla, chocolate and coffee. An exceptional beer.
Bottle. Black colour with a tan head. Aroma is coffee, malt, hop, dried fruit. Flavour is coffee, malt, hop, dried fruit, chocolate, alcohol. Full body. Nice beer.

Black in color with a finger of brown head. Quite spicy on the nose with a lot of roasted malt, coffee, and a mild acidity. A bit of graham cracker and raisin as well. Sweet dark fruits and chocolate on the palate with a heavy roasted malt component. Mild acidity, coffee, and some hints of chalk.

Bottle shared.  Pours black with a thick beige head.  Aroma of roasted malt, chocolate, coffee, raisins, light Christmas spice.  Flavour is medium to heavy sweet and light bitter.  Full bodied with soft carbonation.

33cl bottle from Jacob. Thanks. Pours black with a medium tan head that slowly recedes to a fine film. The aroma is strong with dark fruit, licorice and molasses. The flavor is loaded with dark roasted barley, raisins, dates, burnt toast, walnuts and anise. The palate full and creamy with soft carbonation. Finishes long and dry with lingering licorice. Overall: An outstanding stout, very tasty.

Tap at Witterfest (Fano meet the brewer), King William IV - 20/08/12.
Dark black with a decent sized khaki head - looks the business!!!
Burnt toffee, charred wood, malts, cinnamon and spice on the nose.
Sweet malt flavour allied to vanilla, coffee and marshmallow.
Medium plus in body with a smooth feel.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottle.  Pitch black with a big brown head.  Aroma is chocolate, coffee, roasted malts, caramel, and just a little alcohol, some bourbon as well.  Taste is more of the same, medium sweet and mild-medium bitter.  Finish is lightly bitter, sticky.  Very full bodied, oily, well carbonated for the style/ABV.

[bottle--thanks, fonefan!]
Rich, chocolate aroma with dried fruit--like smelling a Cadbury chocolate with raisins candy bar. Opaque, oily black under a red-dark brown blanket. Complex flavour of sweet pumpernickel, bitter dark chocolate, milk chocolate, dried fruit, and good bitterness to hold it all up. Full body, sweet and bitter chocolate finish, moderate carbonation.

Bottle, shared with Bergen Beer Geek Tasting Crew. Pours a tar black body with a medium, creamy light beige head. Nose is licorice, dark chocolate and hints of roasted grains and nuts. Taste is smooth licorice tones, leather, vanilla, hints of nuts and burnt sugar in the back. Velvety palate, nearly oily. Full body. Nice stuff indeed.

330ml bottle @ vPBF

Pours pitch black with a nice brown sticky head.
Aroma of roasty malts, vanilla, chocolate, coffee, salty licorice, molasses and spices.
Taste is roasty and sweetish with notes of chocolate, salty licorice, molasses and spices.
Finish of sweetish roasty malts, hints of smoke, chocolate, spices and vanilla. Strong, slightly boozy in the end. Nice, quite well balanced strong porter.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Pitch black colour, mediumsized brown head. Aroma is roasted malts, some toffee, alcohol and some mild spicy notes. Flavour is liquorice, some slight salted liquorice notes. Sweet caramel and some quite pleasant spicy notes.

33 cl bottle @ vPBF. Batch #300. BBE 2015.
Pours black color with small beige head. Aroma of dark toasted malts, chocolate, rye, bread and some dark ripe fruits. Flavor of dark toasted malts, chocolate, mild fruits, tar, faint rye, some syrupy notes and light liquorice. Dry malty palate, chocolaty dry finish. Nice.
4426

Bottled 330ml (BB 2015, vPBF)
Dark opaque black color, good brown head. Rye bready, toasted aroma. Medium to full bodied. Toasted, licorice, cough candy flavor. Liquierish palate. Good.

33 cl bottle @ vPBF. Batch #300 BBE 2015
Rated while listening to aitoa_menoa.avi
Aroma is sweetish with syrupy notes, raisins and some licorice. 
Flavour is somewhat tart with salty licorice, some coffee and hints of soy sauce. Too salty but good anyway.

330 ml bottle @ vPBF 2012.
Pours a pitch black colour with a creamy, large, beige head. High viscosity. Aroma of roasted malts, smoke and some dried fruits. Flavour of roasted malts, rye bread, soy sauce, dried fruits, cream and dark chocolate. Also quite strong bitterness. Full bodied, thick mouthfeel and a long, roasty, warming and quite heavy malty finish. A winter warmer.

330 ml bottle courtesy of  Gunfryd. Pitch black body with a small but solid beige head. Aroma of dark malt, mocha, coffee and dry fruit. Flavor is sweet, dark malt, coffee, dark chocolate and a pleasant bitterness with a hint of liquorices. Fine body and good aftertaste. A really nice, tasty and balanced beer.

21/07 RBESG Grand Tasting, 0.33 l bottle. It poured pitch black body with smaller brownish head. Nice strong coffee, licorice and alcoholic aroma. Flavor was sweet, slightly bitter and sour, with roasted malts dominating, e.g. coffee, chocolate, licorice. Alcohol wasnt too hidden, it was sharp, but extremely heavy body was quite successful in smoothing it. Long finish, of course, with lot of chocolate, caramel, licorice and alcohol. I liked this one very much, although it would certainly be much better aged. What a delicacy would it be!

Bottle... This beer rocks!... Coal black ale with a mid-sized, creamy, well-tanned head that never dissipates. The nose presents luxuriant notes of fudge, espresso, chocolate creme and a gentle note of cinnamon flanked by a trace of singed marshmallow. Full-bodied and velvety with soft carbonation. The flavor displays great balance amongst all its decadence - dark chocolate and espresso really stand out. More chocolate creme and suggestions of pouch tobacco intermingled with singed marshmallow. Silky smooth with no rough edges. Finishes mildly bitter, scorched and a touch minerally. Big-time kudos go out to Plovmand for shipping this world class brew across the pond!

Black with a dense inch of brownish foam. Aroma is mild roasty with hints of caramel and toffee. Some nuts..
Taste is roasty with mild coffee and chocolate. Raisins and dark fruits in the back with a mild bitter finish. Very mellow and pleasant. Full body and slightly oily on the palate. Soft carbonation.

Cheers to Papso for this bottle.
Black with dark head.  Aromas of chocolate and roasted malt.  Flavor follows the aroma but with strange probably woody acidity.  Good carb and consistency, very nice beer.

RBESG 12, Bratislava. Grand Tasting at Richtar Jakub. 33cl Bottle. Black colour, beige-brown head. Aroma of hard roasted malts, chocolate, quite sweet, pipe tobacco, coffee. Flavour is sweet but smooth, creamy, chocolate, coffee, hard roasted malts, bitter roasted light hoppy finish. Fullbodied, smooth. Good.

RBESG GT 2012. Poured a black body with a brown head. Raisins, ? and maltiness in the aroma. Smooth taste, raisins malty and spicey, cloves, very light yeastiness, very light... figs. I liked this a lot.
Dark brown body, creamy tan head. Smooth body, cream, chocolate. Nice. Creamy body. Excellent brew!

Bottle shared at a cottage near Blokhus, summer 2012
Pours black with a smooth small brown head. The look is just amazing! Smells of caramel, coffee, roasted malts and hints of liquorice. Heavy sweet, quite dry, roast and toast, coffee, some smoke and tar. Heavy bitter, asfalt and earth. Full body, very oily texture, soft carbonation. A very nice IS, very dark flavors and aroma, a beer that please my palate

RBESG 2012 Grand tasting. Dark brown, almost black colour. Aroma peat, roasted, smoke, caramel. Taste a bit sharp, ashy, light heavy bitter, light heavy sweet, almost medium tartness. Finish rather dry, tart, good beer.

RBESG 2012 Grand Tasting. Almost black color with medium beige head.
Aroma of roasted malt, chocolate and licorice. Sweet taste with chocolate, dark berries, coffee,roasted malt, vanilla Nice dry bitter finish. Nice.

330 ml bottle. Batch #300. From Ølbutikken, Copenhagen, Denmark. 
Pitch black colour with small brown head.
Very dry aroma of ash, dark roasted malt and touhc of anise.
Flavour is super balanced and rich. Theres roasted malt, liquorice, ash and mild spicyness. 
As a 10% brew theres no signs of alcohol. Well... its making this beer but still its well hidden. Extremely balanced.

(Bottle, 0.33 l, courtesy of rosenbergh, 20120721) The beer poured black. Its head was medium sized and lightly brown. Aroma had roasted malts, liquorice and hops. Palate was full bodied and oily with medium carbonation. Flavours were roasted malts, ash, dark chocolate, hops and bitterness. Aftertaste had roasted malts, liquorice and bitterness. A very well balanced brew and alchol was well hidden. A good example of skillful brewing.

33 cl bottle.
Pitch black with a rather big, brown three finger head that settles quickly, leaving nice lacings on the glass.
The aroma is very balanced and full. Brown sugar, syrup and plenty of dried dark fruits(figs, dates, prunes and the works...). 
Roasty and sweet, but never too much. Again, balanced.
Almost don´t want to finish this glass, as I´d rather keep smelling it! Loving this... 
Damn near perfect aroma in my book!
Looks and tastes almost as good as it looks...
Where can I get more?

Bottle from Havnens Vin & Tobakhus, VejleBlack color with brown creamy head. Roasted malt aroma, and coffee, initially; with semi-pungent spices (maybe ginger and cinnamon), followed by some cardboard; clumsy, it feels like 7-eleven while waiting for the train in the night. Good body strength; the flavor is a very good mix of dark chocolate and roasted malt, with a good share of liquorice, while the spices are fairly covered, therefore less evident and more pleasant, although some cinnamon tries to stick out; good balance.Very good, but Im not excited by this usage of spices.

25 June 2012, bottle lack and looks a bit thin. Nose is meaty and soy sauce without the salt. Thin body and almost flat. Faintly meaty, slightly sweet (not salty) soy sauce, and a very dark chocolate finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

33cl bottle. Pours opaque black with a lovely crema head. The nose has a smokey, salty and savoury - in fact totally umami. The taste has serious tar and salty liquorice. The palate is rich in structure with a gorgeous creamy and tangy with a long creamy and tangy finish. Overall, a stunning beer of individual personality.

33cl bottle shared by Arve_Christian. Pours black with a beige head. Very christmassy aromas in this one. Malty aroma with christmas spices, chocolate and dried dark fruits. Full body. Sweet and choclaty with spicy and slightly hoppy finish. (2012-06-16)

On bottle from Õlbutikken, Købemhavn.
Black color, ok foam.
Notes of  piney aromas & Christmas spices.
Full bodied & high complexity.
Enjoyable

Bottle:
Big vast brown head, disappears slow and leaves a thick brown lacing over a pitch black colored beer.
Smell oatmeal, hint of manure, liquorice, roasted liquorice wood, some hops, stingy roasted grains, roasted barleys, crey coffee/espresso, 
Taste is a mix of good bitter, liquorice, coal, crayon, roasted/burned malts, roasted liquorice wood, dark chocolate, espresso, light creamy and light sticky.
Aftertaste is bitter roasted liquorice wood, grass an some chocolate drenched hops.
Low carbo, soft creamy mouthfeel, creamy sticky texture and a full body.
Good beer, would love to see this barrel aged.
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: Bottle sample at a tasting at DSGs place. Thanks DSG. Pours an opaque brown to black with a nice brown to beige head, aroma of coffee, roast, white chocolate, caramel, flavor of wood, smoke, apple sourness, cork, coffee, hoppy bitterness, some cherry sourness, full bodied, very nice
Una robust porter veramente impressionante! Tanto corpo, tanto cioccolato e una bella botta di caffé finale ad equilibrare il tutto.

9th May 2012Bottle from Olbutikken. Opaque black beer with a thick dark tan head. Soft viscous palate. Semi dry. Smooth rich dark malt. A whisper of roast. Traces of coffee and licorice. Mild lacto glues it all together. Finishes soft and smooth and dry. Licorice and coffee linger on. Nice porter - soft and drinkable.

Bottle sample at a tasting at DSGs place. Thanks DSG.  Pours black, opaque, tan frothy head. Earthy, sweet liquorm truffle aroma, tastes a little alcoholic, spicy - mainly black pepper, mildly bitter.  Medium body, unpleasant muddy finish, lively carbonation.

Bottle with great thanks to the wolf. Pours a very dark brown with smallish cream coloured head. Nice aromas of roasted grain, creamy milk chocolate and some alcohol. Really good. Flavours show this sweetness before a decent bitter finish thanks to the roasted grain. Medium slick mouthfeel. Really nice beer.
Bottle courtesy of Ryan with Hair, thanks!  Very dark brown color, dark brown head.  Aroma of slightly boozy, slightly sour coffee.  Taste is rich chocolate dipped in French roast coffee.  Very nice.

Bottle shared at a tasting at home. Thanks Pundarquartis for this bottle! Black with a huge brown head. Aroma of burnt malt, some coffee, spiciness and a bit of alcohol. Bittersweet flavor with heavily roasted malt, some coffee beans, light smokiness and spices. Finishes bitter and spicy. Medium to full-bodied.

33cl bottle [from trade with Fonefan] @ home. Pitch black color, full sized medium brown head that lasts and leaves a fair lacing. Smell dark and roasted malts, earth, bitter, coffee. Taste dark and roasted malts, light to moderately coffee, hint of moccha, slightly earthy and medium bitterness, but mostly a balanced roastyness. Very nice! Bitter finish with a slight moccha and coffee hint guiding the roastyness. Medium to full carbonation, full body, medium oily texture. Ahh whatever ;) Just a great beer!

Bottled, thanks fonefan!  Very black, small head. Blueberry and licorice together sith salt and tar in the nose. Intense and full bodied with clean, rounded mouthfeel. More blueberries later, togather with tobacco and white pepper. Long salty bitterness. Solid, full flavoured and well made in every aspect.

Bottle, 33 cl, courtesy of Papsø, thanx. Thick and black brew with a nice creamy, mostly lasting dark brownish head. Aroma is dark : Dark sugar, dark roasted malts, dark chocolate, dark coffee, dark fruits, dark rhum, licorice dark flowery hops, very enticing, layer upon layer of aroma. Flavor is deep and sweet, mellow roast, licorice, dark dries fruits, flowery hops, burned medium bitter malty finish and weightless aromatic hops on top of it all. Long lingering, dry finish. Well hidden alcohol.

Bottle from Ølkonsortiet, Ålborg. Pours pitch black with a huge frothy dark tanned head.Aroma is heavy roasted malts, chocolate and liquorice. Taste is heavy liquorice, deep roasted malts and dark caramel, some coffee. Lingering sweet malty goodness paired with smooth liquorice, good enough for me.

Rating #2000. Bottle 33cl from Henrik Papsoe thanks a lot ! A dark and thick beer with huge brown head. Nose is intense on roasted and coffee notes. Aroma is very sweet, intense caramel and licorice note, dry grapes, creamy, dark coffee, floral notes such as violette, blackcurrant, mint and smoked touch. Peppery hops and slightly acrid at the finish. A well done beer, very tasty and creamy, alcohol is well hidden.

330ml Bottle:  Got in trade from stobbe74; THANKS Soeren!  Aroma of malt, roasting, soy sauce, tar, burnt grain, burnt wood, and licorice.  Poured pitch black in color with a medium-sized, creamy, dense, brown head that diminished but lasted throughout.  Opaque.  Sparkling.  Flavor is medium to heavily sweet.  Tastes just like it smells, of malt, roasting, soy sauce, tar, burnt grain, burnt wood, and licorice.  Medium body.   Slick, creamy, texture.  Soft carbonation.  Medium sweet, slightly bitter, malt, roasting, soy sauce, tar, burnt grain, burnt wood, and licorice finish is slightly dry.  10%ABV is completely hidden throughout.

Bottle......It pours pitch black with a large creamy thick long lasting tan head..... The aroma is hard roasted malts, dark fruits, chocolate and coffee.....The flavor is hard roasted malt, dark fruits, Chocolate, coffee and licorice....... Full body.......very nice

Pours dark brown with a light brown head. Aroma is roasted male, dark fruit, vanilla, oak and light orange peal. Flavour is roasted malt, cold coffee, vanilla, oak, dark fruit, light orange and pale chocolate. Quite sticky. Really well balanced.
Würziger Beginn von Chilinoten und dunkelmalzigem Getreide. Mild, rund, glücklicherweise aber nicht zu mild. Herb, unscheinbar. Leider nur OK. /9/9/8//9

Bottle @ Dans house. Huge thanks René! Deep brown black appearance with a small brown head. Pretty sweet, somewhat fruity, sweet milk chocolate, light anise, light vanilla aroma. Tangy, anise, dark chocolate, somewhat roasty, lightly fruity, fairly spicy flavor. Fairly spicy aftertaste. Nice brew.

Pour out of bottle, thanks Aaron and Renee for this beer! Dark black pour with nice creamy tan head, aroma has notes of dark chocolate, hints of pine and grass from the hops, touch of dark fruit, anise, touch of slight mineral but fairly nice.  Taste is a mix of dark fruits, toffee, caramel, hints of chocolate, toffee, nice spice with slight ginger and cumin, touch of coffee, finishes fairly bitter. Pretty nice!
Sampled with evil stepdad. Black look with a medium brown head. Roasted coffee aroma, raisins and spices, maybe cloves. Sweet raisin and spicy flavor along with a pretty complex roasted bitterness.

Bottle 330ml @ yngwie
Pours pitch black with a tan head. Aroma has notes of rosted malt, chocolate, caramel, licorice, coffee and a hint of alcohol. Taste is medium to heavy sweet and light to medium bitter with a long roasty chocolate, . Body is full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

Bottle, courtesy of Meilby. Pours black with a brown head. Aroma of malt, some alcohol, chocolate and licorise. Flavor is sweet and malty with some chocolate, roasted malt, caramel and alcohol. Medium body, average carbonation.Nice ,but a bit short.

Bottle. A big, dark brown head forms over a jet black body. Roasted malts, coffee, licorice, a touch of prunes and alcohol on the nose. Really pleasant. Soft and oily on the palate, slighlty warming, with roasted malts and chocolate, as well as some licorice, soy sauce hints and coffee. Lasting roasted finish. Could maybe use more hop flavors, but its sure a nice beer anyway. 120324

Huge thanks to Theis, shared with Sarah. Pours black with a dark brown head that dissipates to the edges and laces slightly. Aroma has a good amount of roast malts with strong bitter chocolate not and a hint of dryness. Flavor has a good amount of coffee with growing roast in the finish and a bit of dark chocolate and dryness in the finish.

(33 cl bottle from Wohlenberg; batch 300) Pours pitch black with rich, brown head that lasts and laces the glass. Aroma is dark roasted, chocolate and coffee. Thick, viscous consistency, soft carbonation, full body with a warming finish. Taste is roasted malt with flavours of hops and smoke. Alcohol is well hidden. Quite a surprisingly drinkable beast for the heavy ABV and consistency. Im reminded of Flying Dogs Gonzo but this one takes it a step further.

At first a massive brown  head, but i slowly falls. Black. Dark roasted nose. Fullbodies´d and some length. high carb. Taste is vanilla, chocko, coffe, sweet liquorice,  really nice but the carb is to high.

Bottle shared by Mortlach. Thanks, Luca! Aroma of charcoal, coffee, chocolate and blackberries. Black as oil, with lace. Flavor is wood, ash, coffee, chocolate, and nice, sweet, berries. Nicely sweet, though the finish is bitter. Rich as hell, well carbonated. Very nice.

(bottle) pours a deep black colour with a quickly diminishing dark brown head. aroma of milk chocolate, brown sugar and toasted malts, with hints of soy sauce and rubbery smoke. flavour is mostly just toasted malts, coffee and a hint of gooseberries, with a slightly tart finish. heavy-bodied with lively carbonation.

06/03/2012 330ml bottle, via trade (thanks fonefan!). Bevuta al 4:20 con KyotoLefty e Alex420. Nerissima, impenetrabile, schiuma color cappuccino, molto scura, incredibilmente persistente. Intenso aroma di malti tostati, cioccolata fondente e caffé, con note di ciliegia e liquirizia. In bocca è molto complessa, rotonda, perfettamente bilanciata nelle sue componenti, cioccolato fondente e caffè. Corpo medio, carbonazione soft. Grandissima imperial porter!
@ ACBF 2012. Black and opague. Roast and licorice in the aroma. Almost tart in the roasty flavor. Dried citrusfruit.

Both aroma and taste of very roasty, almost burnt, notes of malt along with fruity coffee and chocolate. Quite viscous mouthfeel and added notes of licorice and some hoppy bitterness to the aftertaste. Excellent beer!
Leathery and chocolate aroma. Sweet chocolate and roasted coffee beans taste.

From Aakjærs, DK.
Bottled, 040312.
Black with beige head. Aroma of coffee and malt. Flavor with spices, liqourice and chocolate.

Draft @ 5th ACBF 2012. A black colored beer, with a dark brown head. It disappears quickly. The aroma of coffee with burned malt. The taste is dry bitter, coffee, notes of chocolate. The aftertaste is bitter,coffee with a little sweet fruits.

Very thick-set rust-beige head, slightly irregular over black beer, pouring viscously. Very intense, nearly tangible aroma of coffee, dark chocolate, but also of dark berries (blueberries, billberries, even blackcurrant); and also other grains. Very outspoken, but mild-bitter coffee, moccha and dark grains flavour; ending in chocolate or chocolate/cacao Ersatz. Maltbomb with syrup, sugar, and praliné cream, hopped. Very rich and nourishing, viscous to solid, slight alcoholheat. Impressive, really. One of those Danish superbrews, but one that achieves a rare balance.

Bottle @ chriso. Pours a black color with a small tan head. Has a roasted malty chocolate licorice flavor with weak smoke hints. Roasted malty chocolate coffee and licorice flavor. Has a roasted malty bitter chocolate and coffee finish.

Bottle @ ACBF 2012: black with a mocha head, smells of bitter roasted malts, caramel & plenty of cocoa and mocha, taste is slightly bitter roasted malts upfront blended together with mocha, chocolate & on the sweeter side coffee, liquorish, toffee, caramel & dark fruits leading into a lingering bitter finish of roasted malts and some hops, substantial, slick porter body, quite a good one
Bottle. High creamy and lasting light brown head. Pitch black body. Coffee liquorice creamy aroma and flavor. Nice albeit smooth hops bitterness. Low carbonation. Long aftertaste.

Bottle at Chrisos Fullers-Gales Tasting. It pours very dark brown-black, with a thin dark tan head. The nose is tar, liquorice, coconut, roasted malt and charcoal. The taste is coconut, roasted malt, coffee, salted caramel, liquorice, toffee and dark chocolate, with a warming finish. Full body (coats your mouth) and fine carbonation, with a thick, oily mouth-feel. Well balanced and surprisngly smooth. Good stuff indeed.
Glad I could taste this one. Good roasted cofee and chocolate, with a nice fruity sweetness combined together. Misses a head and some carbonation, but besides that, very decent.

Black with a huge and beatiful reddish brown head - lots of lacings. The aroma is a bit on the weak side, but does give some impression of roasted malts, caffe latte and spices. The flavour starts moderately sweet and goes into a nice bitterness with liqourice in the end. A well crafted brew.

Bottle. Creamy lightbrown excellent fully lasting head. Black colour. Moderate malty and hoppy aroma. Heavy bitter flavor. Dry and woody flavor. Some licorice notes. Average long heavy bitter finish. Creamy palate. Wonderfull.

UPDATED: NOV 9, 2012 Bottled. Pours pitch black with a medium sized, lasting, tan head. Good lacing. Nose of roasted malts, chocolate and licorice. Sweet flavor with slightly roasted malts chocolate, vanilla, dark fuit and hoppy notes. Medium to full bodied, soft carbonation and oily texture. Ends up more dry with atiny bitterness. An excellent brew.★★★★

Sample from 33 cl. bottle. Pitch black with a creamy and fat long lasting tanned head. Nice, thick laces. The aroma is hard roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, sweet dark fruits, light hits of liquorice and toasted caramel. Rich and full taste with hard roasted malts and hop bitterness with notes of tobacco, chocolate, coffee and liquorice. Full body with a thick texture. Long, roasted finish with some hops and ashes. Excellent beer.
Low head smooth taste porter. An enhanced version of the Limfjordsporter with a smiler appearance

Bottle at DØE tasting.
Black with a large light brown head , nice lacings. Aroma heavy malty (chocolate, licorice, roasted, vanilla, coffee, cinnamon). Flavor heavy sweet, medium bitter from dark malts and hops, light spicy. Full body, smooth. Well balanced, despite the spices.
33 cl bottle, aroma of coffee, chocolate, licorice and caramel, taste follows the nose, smooth mouthfeel, suprisingly light drinkable, decent bitterness , very long finish, execellent overall!
(Bottle 20/02-2012) Medium brown head, black color, roasted aroma, dry roasted taste, soft co2, smooth taste.
Black coloured beer with a medium beige head. Aroma is roasted malts, chocolate. Flavor is quite the same roasted malts, chocolate and coffee. Heavy palate and long roasted aftertaste.

33cl bottle shared with a friend.
Very thin off white head.  Very deep pour.  Yummy beer
Draught, 10%. Mild coffee aroma. Black colour, small dark brown head. The flavour is sweet and roasted. Good citric hop note with a hint of marmalade. Powerful but well-balanced.

Bottle at Chris Os tasting. Oily opaque colour with a tan head. Nose is dark choc, roasted malt, black coffee and a muddy earthiness. Mouthfeel is oily. Taste is dark chocolate, coffee and with a bitter roasted grain finish. Only criticism is that it was a touch too carbonated.

Bottle at chriso Vintage Tasting. Pours oily black with a creamy, brown cap. Dark malts and light spices in the nose. Medium sweet flavor with moderate roast, some dark chocolate syrup, subtle spice, dark bread. Full bodied, very oily, with average carbonation. Warm finish with lots of dark and bitter chocolate, motor oil, burnt earth, persistent yet mild spice. Nice beer. Very solid.

Bottle 33 cl. Pours thick and syrupy pitch black with a massive 2 inch light brown head with a lengthy retention - probably one of the best looking beers Ive had for a long while. Sweetish chocolate aroma combined with licorice overpowers the roastiness in the nose yet maintains a certain freshness. Solid body, incredibly velvety smooth mouthfeel. Again the roast is downplayed leaving room for sweet chocolate, vanilla, raisins in rum and then also some lovely aromatic hops that prevents this from ever getting cloying in spite of a low bitterness. Incredibly smooth and well balanced. 130212

Bottle at Chriso FullersGales tasting.  Thick black with tan head. Coffee oily choc aroma. Its ok. Bit too oily for me. Bitter on finish. Ok but not outstanding. Decent but like many impy stouts more is maybe not better

Bottle. Thanks to enjoyit and Fonefan. Pours black with a creamy Brown head and lacings. Nose is roast , chocolate and christmas spices.  Smooth , slick and oily. Full bodied. Burnt roasted malty flavor. Coffee, spices and liquorice. Bitter finish.  Although Im Not a fan of the spices used it kind of suits the beer. Well made!
Pours pitch black with a creamy brown head. Smokey, spicey, roasted aroma. Full body, English liquorice.

Bottle 330ml.Clear dark black colour with a large to huge, frothy to creamy, good lacing, fully lasting, light brown head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, roasted, burnt, molasses, chocolate, spicy, pine needles, light alcohol. Flavour is heavy sweet and moderate to heavy bitter with a long duration, dark chocolate, molasses - sugar, licorice notes. Body is medium to full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. Well done Ryan ;O) [20120122]  7-5-9-5-16 
Bottle 330ml.Dark black colour with a huge, frothy to creamy, good lacing, fully lasting, light brown head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, roasted, caramel, chocolate, coffee. Flavour is heavy sweet and bitter with a long duration, coffee, chocolate, dark malt sugar - molasses, light alcohol. Body is medium to full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20120201]   8-5-9-4-17

Kulsort skum nÃ¸dderbrun tÃ¦t lang 
Kaffe malt choklade rÃ¸g vanilje 
Bitter moderat sÃ¸d moderat 
Medium til fuld sirup blÃ¸d 
@f1 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

33cl, as Fanø Bryghus Kunstner Øl No.1, new exclusive Danish brew Anno 2011, thx to Jeppe!, very complex Porter, roasted/spicy and slightly fruity/sweet, not too heavy, balanced, hazy, good head, very good brew, yet expensive!

Pour pitch black, with a small brown head. 
Aroma is quite spicy, with a lot of roastyness to it. Also plenty of coffee, vanilla and oatmeal in here. A Big chocolate aftertaste. 
Taste is sweet, with a roasty, bitter finish. 
Semi-full body, with a flat carb.
Black of color with a nice brown head. An aroma of roasted malt, liqurce, sweets, spice and weak coffee notes. A flavor of roasted malt, liqurice, spice and with a nice bitter oily texture.

Thanks Sam for sharing.  Pours dark black with one finger of dark chestnut brown head, nice viscosity. Nose is rich and dark, lots of fruit skins and some black cherry with hints of spice and savory sweetness.  Lots of dark chocolate and black coffee with some dark fruits and spice. Full and velvety body with a warming finish.
Fantastic Beer, great job Ryan and Klaus. One of the best beers I have ever tasted, looking forward for one of your next beers.

what an awesome brew. Pours a deep black, with an espresso foam head. The beer is powered by roasted coffee, chocolate, and tar. The mouthfeel is soft, all encompassing and delecious. One of the better beers i have tried in this new year. (the xmas in the name is a bit misleading, didnt really have much xmas about it i felt)

Botella. Pitch black colour with a nice steady thick dark brown head, good lacing indeed. Lovely aroma of sweet roasted malt with lots of chocolate and good dark fruitiness indeed, bit smokey too. Thick mouthfeel, nice. Flavou is sweet with lots of roasted malt and chocolate along with dark fruits indeed, liqourice, bit wood and alcohol (pleasant way indeed). Long lasting sweet roasty malty chocolate dark fruity finish. Yuuu-uummmm!

Bottle, bought @ Aakjærs, Esbjerg.
Completely opaque black with a lovely, staying, creamy, beige cappucino head. Elegant aroma, chocolate, some clear raisin, a bit of cinnamon, soft coffee. Medium carbonation, lovely velvety creamy mouthfeel. Flavour has lots of character, chocolate base, light coffee, some hazelnutty Nutella, raisins, light astringent roasted malts (but its very little). Quite bitter overall with no simple sweetness anywhere, just quality maltiness. Some cinnamon and coriander in the bitter dryness. Light cocoa-powder. Softens even more as it warms. Quality balance, no sign of the 10. Yum, Ryan!

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2012 With thanks to my brother for kindly sharing his Christmas gift. Re-rated in February - its a beer that grows with every new tasting. Black with a light brown head. Aroma of licorice and dark chocolate with dried fruit and a hint of cherry. Rich dark flavour of roasted malt, licorice and chocolate with a fruity touch, some cherry, and spicy notes of especially cardemum and cinnamon. Warming, vineous alcohol. A bit of roasted acidity in the finish

Draught at Mikkeller bar.Pitch black colour with large creamy beige head.Aroma is rosted and strong.Flavor of coffee and chocolate thick and oily with well balanced and smooth flavor,full body and soft finish.

Draught at Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen. Black beer with a small lasting beige/brown head. Roasted chocolate aroma, cocoa and licorice, toffee notes and some figs. Roasted chocolate flavor, some toffee, cocoa, licorice, figs, nice hops showing and taking the beer into a bitter roated chocolate finish. Very nice.

What up færgemanden! On tap. Aroma: smoke, roasted, burnt malts, chocolate, coffee, some spices, I get cinnamon, maybe som
Star anis. Deep espresso, some hops, oak, woody, Liquorice, vanilla, sweetness. Taste: Deep, rich. Velvety, loads of chocolate, some spices, cinnamon, very balanced, roasted, fruitiness, coffee, vanilla, some hops, grassy, tingly, Liquorice, thanks Ryan, you bearded beast of a man

Draft. Pitch black with beautiful brown head. Aroma is  sweet of alcohol and chocolate. Taste is chocolate, sweet liquorice and alcohol.. Body is full and soft like velvet, chocolate finish. Very carbonated. Definitely one of the best porters Ive had.

Flaske: Kulsort olieret øl med et kæmpe mørkebrunt skumhoved. Virkelig smuk. Duften er sødlig maltet, med en smule frugt. Smagen derimod er klassisk porter med et ordentligt tvist som man får ved 10 % og en diskret krydren der giver fornemmelser af en østafrikansk bazar før Vasco da Gama. Dejlig øl.

Bottle at ølbutikken with Phredrik! Pours pitch black with a thick dark brown head. - Picture perfect! Aroma is fruity coffee, espresso, cocoa beans, sweet liquorice, ryebread, mocca, vanilla, I sense some hops, roasted notes, gentle chocolate and some christmas spice (cinnamon). Taste is bitter fruity coffee, liquorice, roasted malts, rich and dark chocolate, weak hops, also got that earthy porter thing going on along with some spices here aswell.

UPDATED: JAN 22, 2012 Thanks Ryan.  Dark brown with a tab head.  Nose is lightly spiced, roast, coffee,light cocoa. Nice smell.  Flavor is roast, spice, cocoa.
****************************************** Had this again.  Tasted similar but I think Im going to up the points a little bit.  Why?  Because I can.

25-DEC-2011, bottle @home, from "Ølbutikken". 
Fantastic high lasting brown head on black body. 
Nose is roasted with coffee and loads of chocolate. A hint of mint and smoke. 
Taste has a herbal note and then even more roasted notes like espresso. 
Barrel aging is there, but subtle. A hugh octane porter but smooth an in no way alcoholic. 
Fantastic brew. Rebuy.

Bottled. A pitch black beer with a dark brown head. The aroma has notes of roasted malt and alcohol. The flavor is sweet with notes of roasted malt, chocolate, and alcohol, leading to a dry chocolaty finish.

Bottle at home - shared with Mette. Pitch black - big brown head. Burned. Malts. Licorice. Chocolate. Smoked. Nice hoppy. Light herbal notes. Coffee. Nice coffee. Light burning feeling. Nice bitterness. Poletter. Herbal notes. Lovely - Thanks Ryan & Johnny.

Bottle at Ølbutikken.
Pitch black coloured with a small brown head.
Sweet and roasted aroma of caramel and liquorice with notes of dark chocolate and alcohol.
Roasted flavour of caramel, dark chocolate and liquorice with notes of hops.
Roasted finish.

Bottle at home. Pours jet black with a creamy thick long lasting tan head. Nice thick lacings. The aroma has notes of sweet hard roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, sweet dark fruit, some liquorice and toasted caramel. The flavour is rich on hard roasted malt and has a good malty bitterness. Light ashy with notes of tobacco. Chocolate, coffee and liquorice. Full bodied. Some dark ripe fruity notes. It has a long roasted ashy finish with some hoppy notes. Very good indeed!!

bottle at ølbutikken. Pitch dark, huge smooth light brown head.4 roasted malts,  toffee in the aroma.7 flavor is roasted malts, wood, sweetness, mocha, vanilla sugar, balanced by bitter woody notes and alc. 8 palate is velvety smooth 5

Bottle at Ãlbutikken with RasmusOtt. Pitch black with a lovely dark brown head - very dense bubbles, extremely good looking! Aroma is lovely - roasted malts, coffee, burned bread, espresso, amaretto, chocolate, vanilla, cinnamon.
, all balanced very well. Wonderful aroma. Taste has burned roastiness, tending the bitter side of roast, nice sweetness with dark chocolate and burned caramel, and a decent hoppy bitterness, lots of coffee notes, hints of cinnamon and cocoa. Lovely, complex and balanced all over. One of the best porters Ive had.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

33 cL bottle. Pours a thick, creamy and dense pitch black with a dense dark chocolate brown head. Aroma is coffee, chocolate and light fruity. Thick dark malty, roasted, chocolate and more pronounced coffee. Light fruity smooth touch. Rich dense malty and creamy finish, alcohol presence but otherwise very nicely balanced.

Bottled. (kunstnerøl no 1). Pitch Black coloured.  Huge Dark brown dense head. Aroma of roast, Brown sugar, cocoa, caramel, light spice, and a lot more. Flavour as well is top dollar.  Load of roast,sugar, sweetness light herbs, caramel, coffee and alcohol. Nice. medium to full bodied. Ends on a roasted and sweetnish light coffeeish note. Delicious.

#1007 bottle; Nose is mint, mahogany, weak sweet smoke, honey, late caramel, feel is broad, carb Is quite low, taste is tobacco, leather, some roasted malt, warm, mellow alcohol, weak red apple peel, late weak hops

Tap @ Fairbar. Pours black with a nice sized creamy light brown head. Aroma of roasted malt, oak, coffee, milk chocolate, raisins. Taste is hard roasted malt, coffee, bitter dark chocolate, thick english licorice, dried dark  fruits. Full creamy body, soft carbonation, warming alcohol in the finish. Very nice porter. 031111
A very good beer, a nice balance of bitterness and a creamy constance. Looks perfect, black colour and creamy head.
